results.title: Into your hand
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Denys Brown, Stanley Hawes and Rhonda Small
results.brief_description: A plea to preserve Australia’s native animals. Describes the native fauna and how white settlement, expansion, and clearing land has effected them. Shows how animals such as the red kangaroo, possums, lizards, and ablbatross are caught and banded to enable scientists to study closely their living habits. Professor A.J. marshall questions random methods of pest killing.

results.title: Into the Twentieth Century
results.creator_credit: Ian Potts and Educational Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art of the western world”.
An episode in the comprehensive art history series, Art of the Western World, that focuses on art work from Cubism and abstract art and architecture to Surrealism. Narrated by Michael Wood, this program focuses on the works of such artists as the Fauves, Pablo Picasso, Frank Lloyd Wright, Salvidor Dali and Joan Miro. Through a discussion of the works in their historical, intellectual and social context this program provides both a thorough outline of these periods in art history and underlines their relevance to issues outside the parameters of the works themselves.

results.title: Into the straight
results.creator_credit: Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), McCreadie Bros and T.O. McCreadie
results.brief_description: A melodrama, partly shot on location at Scone, N.S.W., involving romance and intrigue against a background of the world of horse racing and culminating in the Melbourne Cup. The film follows the fortunes of a racehorse breeding family, the Curzons, who need to strengthen their blood stock to re establish a fading reputation. This results in the purchase of a champion English horse, along with a father and son training team. Rivalry develops between the men for the love of the Curzon daughter, and for the attentions of a femme fatale nightclub singer, Zara Marlowe. A mock race was staged at Flemington and Randwick for the film and famous jockeys of the time, Jack Purcell and George Moore make brief personal appearances. Cast includes Charles Tingwell, Muriel Steinbeck and Nonnie Peifer.

results.title: Into the night
results.creator_credit: Rachel Clements, Melissa Johnston, Tony Krawitz and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A lost and fragile boy new to the streets. A wary teenager just thinking about the money. A wealthy man playing out a delicate and lonely game. Over one night their lives intersect in unexpected ways, blurring the line between betrayer and betrayed.

results.title: Into the machine age
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Christopher McCullough and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
The ever expanding American iron and steel industry spawns the railroads that help to reunify a country riven by civil war. In the aftermath of the Chicago fire on 1871, the industry creates the steel-framed skycraper. The discovery of vast reserves of oil, and the advent of mass production, mark the last quarter of the nineteenth century.

results.title: Into the flames
results.brief_description: A personal account of ‘Black Saturday’ bushfires from a young leader, a volunteer from CFA Region 14. Simon speaks of his experiences fighting the blaze - monitoring where campers are located, through to anger from local residents directed at his crew in the heat and panic of the fires.

results.title: Into the deep freeze
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Robert Raymond and Quantum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Man on the rim series”.
This video, the first of four, is about the Pacific Ocean, the people who live around it and across its vast expanse. “First footsteps” explores the theory that the earliest settlers of Australia were perhaps from China. “Hunters and gatherers” describes how the first Australians arrived, occupied and managed their environment. “Into the deep freeze” explains how the people who moved north through China to Siberia coped with the cold and utilised the inexhaustible natural resources. Over two years in the making, this video has breathtaking photography and fascinating narration which illustrate that what we are learning about the Pacific comes from the descendants of the original settlers of this vast area.

results.title: Into the arms of strangers: stories of the Kindertransport
results.creator_credit: Deborah Oppenheimer, Sabine Films, United States Holocaust Memorial Museum and Mark Jonathan Harris
results.brief_description: Between December of 1938 and August of 1939, some 10,000 Jewish and other children were transported from Germany and the German held countries of Austria and Czechoslovakia to Great Britain under the ‘Kindertransport’ initiative. Most were adopted by British families with the majority never seeing their birth parents again. In this documentary, archival footage is interspersed with the recollections of twelve child survivors as well as those of rescuers, parents and foster parents. Through moving, candid, detail-filled commentaries spoken directly to the camera, they each provide personal insights into different aspects of the evacuation. The emotional confusion and pain that is the legacy of the survivors’ extraordinary childhood experiences is poignantly expressed through their conflicting feelings of abandonment, loss, thankfulness, guilt and resentment. (Awards: Winner of ‘Best Documentary Feature’, Academy Awards, 2000)
